title: Yssavo Camacho-Neves presented a poster on “500 Days in the Photospheric Phase of Type Iax Supernova 2014dt” at SuperVirtual 2021.
short_description: Yssavo Camacho-Neves presented a poster on “500 Days in the Photospheric Phase of Type Iax Supernova 2014dt” at *SuperVirtual 2021* in which she used TARDIS for modelling the spectrum of SN 2014dt.

title: Marc Williamson gave a talk on “Reconstructing Exploded Stars: Constraining Helium Mass in Stripped Supernovae” at SuperVirtual 2021.
short_description: Marc Williamson gave a talk on “Reconstructing Exploded Stars: Constraining Helium Mass in Stripped Supernovae” at *SuperVirtual 2021*.

title: Isaac Smith presented a poster on “Documenting Scientific Software” at Mid-Michigan Symposium for Undergraduate Research Experiences 2021.
short_description: Isaac Smith presented a poster on “Documenting Scientific Software” at *Mid-Michigan Symposium for Undergraduate Research Experiences 2021* where he demonstrated how he made TARDIS documentation more user-friendly and interactive.

title: James Gillanders gave a talk on Spectroscopic Modelling of the kilonova AT2017gfo at Irish National Astronomy Meeting in September ’21 in which he demonstrated how he used TARDIS.
short_description: James Gillanders gave a talk on Spectroscopic Modelling of the kilonova AT2017gfo at *Irish National Astronomy Meeting* in September ’21 in which he demonstrated how he used TARDIS.

title: Luke Harvey gave a talk on “Exploring SNe Ia with spectral synthesis code TARDIS” at Irish National Astronomy Meeting in September ’21.
short_description: Luke Harvey gave a talk on “Exploring SNe Ia with spectral synthesis code TARDIS” at *Irish National Astronomy Meeting* in September ’21.

title: Jaladh Singhal gave a lightning talk on “Using Jupyter Widgets to make Astrophysics Research easier” at JupyterCon 2020 where he demonstrated interactive visualizations & widgets he developed at TARDIS.
short_description: Jaladh Singhal gave a lightning talk on “Using Jupyter Widgets to make Astrophysics Research easier” at *JupyterCon 2020* where he demonstrated interactive visualizations & widgets he developed at TARDIS.

title: Ezequiel Passaro presented a poster on “An Open Source Framework for Atomic Data” for Reunión anual de la Asociación Argentina de Astronomía in September ’19.
short_description: Ezequiel Passaro presented a poster on “An Open Source Framework for Atomic Data” for *Reunión anual de la Asociación Argentina de Astronomía* in September ’19 where he demonstrated the TARDIS package carsus.
